fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article about a Radio 4 interview by John Humphrys in which George Osborne criticised the Today programme’s earlier coverage of government spending cuts said incorrectly that Humphrys had told the Guardian that the chancellor’s comments were “obviously a joke”. In fact what Humphrys said was that the earlier comments by a BBC colleague that had apparently angered Osborne were “obviously a joke” (BBC defends ‘hyperbolic coverage’ of cuts after chancellor’s criticism, 5 December, page 10). • A feature in which writers picked their favourite books of 2014 included a recommendation by Ian Rankin for Van Morrison’s Lit Up Inside and said it “collects many of the great man’s favourite lyrics and includes a foreword by poet David Meltzer, a long-time fan”. The reference to David Meltzer was an editing error. Meltzer wrote a foreword for an edition of Lit Up Inside published in the US. The “long-time fan” Ian Rankin was referring to was himself: he wrote the foreword for the UK edition (A book for everyone, 29 November, page 2, Review). • A gardening column about elephant garlic in last Saturday’s Weekend magazine was illustrated wrongly with a photograph of ordinary garlic. Elephant garlic is not a true garlic, but more closely related to leeks (Grow your own elephant – in garlic form, page 127).
